name: Journaling for Game Makers - Toronto Games Week
description:
Game-making is a rigorous endeavour of many moving parts. In order to keep our creative juices flowing, we can use journaling to help us be productive and stay reflexive in the process. Join Tanya Kan from Vivid Foundry in a chat about what kinds of journaling can motivate us in unique ways! Bring your journals and your writing tools. All experience levels and all disciplines are welcome.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: Toronto Outdoor Picture Show at Fort York

location.name: Walled Fort of Fort York National Historic Site - Entry at West Gates

description:
For its fifteenth anniversary, When We Were Young programme will open with Romeo + Juliet, a highly influential take on the timeless tale of star crossed lovers. The 6-night extended opening weekend will also include Lovers Rock, The Wizard of Oz, Y tu mamá también, I Saw the TV Glow, and a thirtieth anniversary screening of Clueless. Films will be screened with closed captioning, for more accessibility details please visit our website.

All TOPS screenings feature pairings of feature films with local and Canadian short films united by theme and style. Also included are coming of age-themed pre-show programming every evening, such as vintage lawn games, chalk art painting, a celebratory photo booth, a costume contest, and more.

name: Raymore Park Tree Planting Event
description:
Join us at Raymore Park to plant native trees and shrubs and expand Toronto's urban canopy.

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: Making + Playing a Little Free Library RPG - Toronto Games Week
description:
Spellbinder is quick-play tabletop roleplaying game where players borrow books from a Little Free Library and use the words inside to cast powerful (and unpredictable) spells. Join the creator Mathew Iantorno for a short talk about the challenges of developing a game that interacts with urban space. Then, pick up a book, put on your best wizard hat, and play a short demo of Spellbinder.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! name: New in Town Comedy Night
description:
A lineup of the best pro comedians in Toronto, hosted by Canada’s latest comedy import and one of New Zealand’s top comics.

James Roque is an award-winning comedian and household comedy name...back in New Zealand. He’s just moved here to Toronto and is down to make some friends. Handpicking some of his favorite local comedians to bring you a fun night out of comedy.

Featuring Laura Ramoso and Griffin Toplitsky from Just For Laughs, with hundreds of millions of views online. John Mostyn from Just For Laughs Toronto. Keesha Brownie from Winnipeg Comedy Festival, JFL Originals. Ryan Dillon from Kevin Hart's LOL Network, Winnipeg Comedy Festival, and Arthur Simeon from HBO, CBC, Just For Laughs.

name: XP Game Summit
description:
Over two days, XP Game Summit business to business conference connects global gaming professionals with the knowledge and networks essential for driving business success and unlocking the power of video game IP.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! name: 2-Spirit Cabaret
description:
Back for its ninth edition, celebrate the strength, beauty, and talent of queer and Two-Spirit Indigenous people.

Hosted by Kai Potts, with a stellar lineup to be announced. Come by before the show for a community reception with food and music by DJ KIMIWAN.

name: Institutional Brutalism at University of Toronto Walking Tour

location.name: Start Point - Spadina Subway Station, West Side

description:
Visit the institutional buildings at University of Toronto built in the divisive, widely reviled and under-appreciated style of Brutalism. Discover the merits and limitations of this enduring architectural style, and why it has invoked such strong responses from both the architectural community and the public.

This two kilometre-long tour was developed and will be led by Vik Pahwa, a celebrated architectural photographer specializing in documenting Toronto’s built environment with an emphasis on mid-century modernism. Vik is also a film locations photographer and runs a daily architecture photography blog in its 14th year at vikpahwa.com.

name: Soccer Day In Toronto: One Year to FIFA World Cup 2026™ Kickoff
description:
The countdown is on! On Thursday, June 12, we’re celebrating one year until the FIFA World Cup 2026™ kicks off in Toronto, and the City is proclaiming the first-ever Soccer Day in Toronto.  
 
Join the celebrations and countdown event at Nathan Phillips Square, featuring music, giveaways, the unveiling of the Official FIFA World Cup 26™ Toronto Countdown Clock and more. 

Official Countdown Clock unveiling and remarks begin at 5:30 p.m.

Post photos and videos on social media using the hashtag #SoccerDayToronto to show you’re celebrating and tag us @fwc26toronto.  No jersey? No problem – wear red and white for Team Canada.

name: xXx_FANTASYLAND_xXx at Toronto Games Week
description:
A transgressive multimedia project combining music, live performance, and videogames to create a dreamlike landscape which captures the objectification of trans and racialized bodies. Blending dance with surreal horror, it utilizes the medium of videogames as a storytelling tool where the player’s participation is integral.

name: Sand Flight
description:
Experience the world premiere from internationally renowned choreographer Ingri Fiksdal. Eight dancers and a 50-person choir descend on a massive sand dune under the Gardiner Expressway for a powerful performance that speculates on climates-to-come, where shade-worshipping is the new normal.

Presented in partnership with Toronto Dance Theatre and featuring VIVA Singers Toronto, Sand Flight highlights an original composition and a cast of local and international performers. This bold new work of climate fiction is a call to closely consider the evolution of our local environments in the not-so-distant future, while creating new customs that will collectively be valued in a changing world.

name: The Sound of Our Nation: A Canadian Songbook
description:
Join us for a performance that joyfully showcases some of the finest musical theatre performers in the country for an unforgettable evening of iconic songs from the Canadian songbook. From heartfelt ballads to anthemic classics, this one-of-a-kind concert captures the spirit, unity, and hope of a country in motion. 

Celebrate the soul of our country through the songs that define it.

name: Film Festival: Best of ACTION/ADVENTURE Shorts from around the world.
description: Showcasing the best action and adventure short films from the last year from around the world today. Followed by Q and A with filmmakers in attendance. For full line-up of films, please visit our website.

name: The Wedge Lecture
description:
An annual lecture program with a focus on connecting the local and the global. 

This year's lecture will feature award-winning designer Stephen Burks in conversation with acclaimed architects Shane Laptiste and Tura Cousins Wilson of SOCA (Studio of Contemporary Architecture) as they explore how art,  architecture, and design can challenge dominant narratives, reclaim identity, and imagine new futures.
